keel.Dataset

Class InstanceSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Dataset.InstanceSet

  • public class InstanceSet
extends java.lang.Object

    InstanceSet

    The instance set class mantains a pool of instances read from the keel formated data file. It provides a set of methods that permit to get each instance, get the whole set of instances, get the number of instances, etc.
    Version:
    keel0.1
    Author:
    Albert Orriols Puig
    See Also:
    Instance, Attributes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      InstanceSet()
      It instances a new instance of InstanceSet
      InstanceSet(boolean nonStaticAttributes)
      InstanceSet This constructor permit define if the attribute's definition need to be stored as non-static (nonStaticAttributes = true).
      InstanceSet(InstanceSet is)
      Creates a new InstanceSet with the header and Instances from the passed object It performs a deep (new allocated) copy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InstanceSet

        public InstanceSet()
        It instances a new instance of InstanceSet

      • InstanceSet

        public InstanceSet(boolean nonStaticAttributes)
        InstanceSet This constructor permit define if the attribute's definition need to be stored as non-static (nonStaticAttributes = true). Otherwise, if nonStaticAttributes = false, using this constructor is equivalent to use the constructor by default.

      • InstanceSet

        public InstanceSet(InstanceSet is)
        Creates a new InstanceSet with the header and Instances from the passed object It performs a deep (new allocated) copy.
        Parameters:
        is - Original InstanceSet

    • Method Detail

      • setAttributesAsNonStatic

        public void setAttributesAsNonStatic()
        setAttributesAsNonStatic It stores the static-defined attributes in the class Attributes as non static in the object attributes. After this it does not remove the static-definition of the Attributes; this is in that way to permit to call this functions for differents datasets from the same problem, such as, a train dataset and the correspondent test dataset.

      • getAttributeDefinitions

        public InstanceAttributes getAttributeDefinitions()
        getAttributeDefinitions It does return the definition of the attibutes contained in the dataset.
        Returns:
        InstanceAttributes contains the attribute's definitions.

      • readSet

        public void readSet(java.lang.String fileName,
                    boolean isTrain)
             throws DatasetException,
                    HeaderFormatException
        This method reads all the information in a DB and load it to memory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - is the database file name.
        isTrain - is a flag that indicate if the database is for a train or for a test.
        Throws:
        DatasetException - if there is any semantical error in the input file.
        HeaderFormatException - if there is any lexical or sintactical error in the header of the input file

      • parseHeader

        public void parseHeader(InstanceParser parser,
                        boolean isTrain)
        It reads the information in the header of the file. It reads relation's name, attributes' names, and inputs and outputs.
        Parameters:
        parser - is the parser of the data set
        isTrain - is a boolean indicating if this is a train set (and so parameters information must be read) or a test set (parameters information has not to be read).

      • isOutputInfered

        public boolean isOutputInfered()
        Test if the output attribute has been infered.
        Returns:
        True if the output attribute has been infered. False if not.

      • getNumInstances

        public int getNumInstances()
        It returns the number of instances.
        Returns:
        an int with the number of instances.

        public Instance getInstance(int whichInstance)
        Gets the instance located at the cursor position.
        Returns:
        the instance located at the cursor position.

      • getInstances

        public Instance[] getInstances()
        It returns all the instances of the class.
        Returns:
        Instance[] with all the instances of the class.

      • getInputNumericValue

        public double getInputNumericValue(int whichInst,
                                   int whichAttr)
                            throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the value of an integer or a real input attribute of an instance in the instanceSet.
        Parameters:
        whichInst - is the position of the instance.
        whichAttr - is the position of the input attribute.
        Returns:
        a String with the numeric value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of the instance set size.

      • getOutputNumericValue

        public double getOutputNumericValue(int whichInst,
                                    int whichAttr)
                             throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the value of an integer or a real output attribute of an instance in the instanceSet.
        Parameters:
        whichInst - is the position of the instance.
        whichAttr - is the position of the output attribute.
        Returns:
        a String with the numeric value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is out of the instance set size.

      • removeInstance

        public void removeInstance(int instNum)
        It does remove the instance i from the instanceSet.
        Parameters:
        instNum - is the instance removed from the instanceSet.

      • removeAttribute

        public boolean removeAttribute(InstanceSet tSet,
                               boolean inputAtt,
                               int whichAtt)
        It does remove an attribute. To remove an attribute, the train and the test sets have to be passed to mantain the coherence of the system. Otherwise, only the attribute of the train set would be removed, leaving inconsistent the instances of the test set, because of having one extra attribute inexistent anymore.
        Parameters:
        tSet - is the test set.
        inputAtt - is a boolean that is true when the attribute that is wanted to be removed is an input attribute.
        whichAtt - is a integer that indicate the position of the attriubte to be deleted.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the attribute has been deleted

      • getHeader

        public java.lang.String getHeader()
        It returns the header.
        Returns:
        a String with the header of the file.

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(java.lang.String copia)

      • getAttHeader

        public java.lang.String getAttHeader()

      • setAttHeader

        public void setAttHeader(java.lang.String copia)

      • getNewHeader

        public java.lang.String getNewHeader()
        It does return a new header (not necessary the same header as the input file one). It only includes the valid attributes, those ones defined in @inputs and @outputs (or taken as that role following the keel format specification).
        Returns:
        a String with the new header

      • getOriginalHeaderWithoutInOut

        public java.lang.String getOriginalHeaderWithoutInOut()
        It does return the original header definiton but without @input and @output in there

      • print

        public void print(java.io.PrintWriter out)
        It prints the dataset to the specified PrintWriter
        Parameters:
        out - is the PrintWriter where to print

      • printAsOriginal

        public void printAsOriginal(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                            int printInOut)
        It prints the dataset to the specified PrintWriter. The order of the attributes is the same as in the original file
        Parameters:
        out - is the PrintWriter where to print
        printInOut - indicates if the @inputs (1), @outputs(2), both of them (3) or any (0) has to be printed

      • print

        public void print()

        Remove all instances from this InstanceSet

        public void addInstance(Instance inst)
        It adds the passed instance at the end of the present InstanceSet
        Parameters:
        inst - the instance to be added

      • clearNonStaticAttributes

        public void clearNonStaticAttributes()
        Clear the non-Static attributes. The static class Attributes is not modified.

      • addAttribute

        public void addAttribute(Attribute at)
        Appends the given attribute to the non-static list of the current InstanceSet
        Parameters:
        at - The Attribute to be Appended
